data.title: string methods not showing up
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: January 2017 (version 1.9)
- OS Version: macOs Sierra 10.12.3 (16D32)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. when I have a variable of the type string and I would like to use the build in functions of string, it does not show up as a option in the code.
2. I have declared and assigned a new var which is a html string, html. When I want to use the replace method with a new variable, newHtml = hmtl.replace I don't see that I can use the replace method.

I hope this is clear.
Br,
Lino

data.title: How should this be set
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.9.1
- OS Version:win 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
```javascript
<script>{$rulejson}</script>
```
This is my code
will automatically be converted to
```javascript
<script>
	{
		$rulejson
	}
</script>
```
How to set no conversion?
What I want is：
```javascript
<script>{$rulejson}</script>
```

data.title: Telemetry for emmet expansions
data.body:
Telemetry events get logged for all commands. Emmet expansion is one of them.
But emmet expansion command can result in no expansion as well.
Therefore, adding telemetry for event when emmet expansion is successful

data.title: Typing text in a link - underline shifts after a second
data.body:
Does not repro in 1.9

- Have an underlined link in an editor
- Type more text in the link
- Its underline starts too high, then after a second, drops down to the right spot

![feb-23-2017 21-15-34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/23291432/52fba580-fa0d-11e6-8a3d-53bd4843498e.gif)

data.title: C++ Syntax Hightlighting acts strangely with multi-line defines.
data.body:
Multi-line defines don't seem to terminate correctly.

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Images probably better than written steps.

Current:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/622619/23291048/6a21067a-fa4d-11e6-9e24-6153362ad304.png)

Better (fixed by adding an extra semi-colon):
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/622619/23291060/7cfd56fe-fa4d-11e6-8e74-74b0124747c1.png)

Expected:
- Define lines fully syntax highlighted, like the first and second lines.
- Remaining code resumes as normal.

Code for testing convenience:
```#define MAX(a, b) (a > b ? a : b)
#define STATE_BUFFER_SIZE \
    MAX(sizeof(ScreensaverStateHandler), \
    MAX(sizeof(SearchStateHandler), \
    MAX(sizeof(BandScanStateHandler), \
    MAX(sizeof(MenuStateHandler), \
    MAX(sizeof(SettingsStateHandler), \
        sizeof(SettingsRssiStateHandler) \
    )))))
```
Code itself compiles correctly with GCC 4.x.

data.title: Typing Open Bracket Then Close Bracket Produced Unexpected Result when Text is Selected

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
1. In a js file (the issue in not language specific) 
2. Select a string such as `abc`
3. Type `(` and then `)` to try and replace `abc` with `()`

**Expected**
After typing `)`, the file is:

```js
()
```

**Actual**
The file is:

```js
())
```

This behavior is feels inconsistent compared to typing `(` and then `)` without a selection:

![feb-23-2017 18-00-02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/23287452/6631c8d4-f9f2-11e6-8b97-5b0c2232ff23.gif)

data.title: textDocument/didOpen now sending "git:/" prefixed URIs
data.body:
The mssql for VS Code language service application is crashing on today's insider build since the textDocument/didOpen message is now sending "git:/" prefixed URIs.  Previously this event would send "file:/" prefixed URIs which we knew how to interpret.

Is this change intentional that now extensions need to know how to decode the various SCM URI formats?

This is an issue a couple users have reported on our repo at https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-mssql/issues/718.

Here is what one of the message payloads that is causing problems looks like:

"textDocument/didOpen"

{ {
"textDocument": {
**"uri": "git:/d%3A/xplat/test/test3.sql",**
"languageId": "sql",
"version": 1,
"text": ""
} } }

- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install the mssql extension on today's insider build and open a SQL file

data.title: Intellisense not working on composed function
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 64-bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. write a series of functions
2. compose them into a big function (with something like ramda)
3. write jsdocs for composed function with "@function", "@param" and "@return" tags with types
4. export function
5. import and type funcName() the intellisense does not say the correct param type or name or the function description

I have created a repo where you can reproduce:
https://github.com/harounb/vscode-intellisense-issue

data.title: Align mouse events sequence with browsers which support native dnd
data.body:
In Safari and Chrome, we can get following events when you click on a selection and dnd


	mousedown
	mousemove, mousemove ... (the number of mousemove events depend on how fast you move)
	dragstart
	drag, dragover
	drag, dragenter, dragover
    ...
	drag, dragover
	drop
	dragend

However right now, we are implementing our dnd by listening to mousedown and mouse up events, our emitted events are like

	drag
	mousedown
	drop
	drag
    ...
	drag
	mouseup
	drop

Moreover, single click on a selection now emits redundant events

    drag
    mousedown
    mouseup

This is because whenever users click on a selection, right now we think it's a `drag` event but if users release the mouse real quick (we get a `mosueup` event from browser before a `mouse move` event kicks in), we will treat it as a single click. But since we take it as `drag` at the beginning, we emit an unnecessary `drag` event.

data.title: sometimes renaming javascript variable does not work
quickopen and quickoutline will now show the field icon for field symbols
data.body:
This addresses https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21315.

I noticed a few issues:
1) `SymbolKind.to` and `SymbolKind.from` didn't map `SymbolKind.Field` to anything so `SymbolKind.Property` was used by default
2) There were no classes for field icons except for one high contract mapping that field icons shared with variable icons. I could see that the icon used for variables in that location matched `Field_16x.svg`, so I operated under the assumption that in the other locations that variable icon classes were defined, field icon classes should be created to point to the same icon

data.title: Added "Git: Pull (Rebase)" to workspace actions.
data.body:
I don't normally use Pull in my workflows and "Pull (Rebase)" was missing in the actions list. To save clicks - I've added it to the list of Git actions.
 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/79742/23279494/6b7518a8-fa0d-11e6-81b5-e555e65681d3.png)

data.title: Restarting inspect debugger restarts it in legacy mode
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: todays Insider build
- OS Version: macOS latest beta

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start debugger in `"protocol": "inspector"`
Output:
```
node --inspect=29189 --debug-brk --harmony --trace-warnings --nolazy server/index.js 
```
2. Press Restart button in VSCode
Output:
```
node --debug-brk=13951 --harmony --trace-warnings --nolazy server/index.js 
```
My `launch.json` config for node:
```json
   {
      "name": "Launch",
      "type": "node",
      "protocol": "inspector",
      "request": "launch",
      "preLaunchTask": "pm2:stop",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/server/index.js",
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
      "envFile": "${workspaceRoot}/.env",
      "runtimeArgs": [
        "--harmony",
        "--trace-warnings",
        "--nolazy"
      ]
    }
```

data.title: SymbolKind.from and SymbolKind.to do not map SymbolKind.Field
data.body:
I noticed that `SymbolKind.Field` shows up using the [expected icon](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/a32b607f6b109f08a5d9e8e563966390410b3021/src/vs/editor/contrib/suggest/browser/Field_16x.svg) in the suggestion widget but not in the quickoutline widget.

I see that [quickopen.css](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/c67ef57cda90b5f28499646f7cc94e8dcc5b0586/src/vs/editor/contrib/quickOpen/browser/quickOutline.css#L58) defines the field icon for high contrast themes and shares a mapping with variable icons, but this same mapping isn't done elsewhere in the css. 

Further, even if the CSS mapping is changed, in [modes.ts](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/192db5f7d1218a3b03d7af65a237ac06c75cbb78/src/vs/editor/common/modes.ts#L530) `SymbolKind.from` and `SymbolKind.to` do not map SymbolKind.Field and the switch statement falls through to the default `SymbolKind.Property`, so a property icon would be used.

data.title: Cannot debug typescript with node.js
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I really have no idea
2. Magic?

I have been using visual studio code for off and on for a few months now. I have been using it for serious work for about three weeks.

Today I suddenly started getting errors when trying to debug a node.js typescript project.

Prior to these errors I was unable to use the debug side panel.
console.log would however add messages to the debug console.

Today I want to try the debugger to inspect an object returned from a mongodb database using the mongoose library. I added breakpoints but got the error  message:
`Breakpoint ignored because generated code could not be found (source map problem?)`

I searched the problem and found [this question on SO](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/36006303/vs-code-breakpoint-ignored-because-generated-code-not-found-error) 

I set `"sourceMaps": true` in launch.json (no discernible result)

I changed  
`"outFiles" : []`  
to 
`"outFiles": ["${workspaceRoot}/**/*.js"]` 

 When attempting to debug with that setting changed it would just hang. 

launch.json
```
{
    // Use IntelliSense to learn about possible Node.js debug attributes.
    // Hover to view descriptions of existing attributes.
    // For more information, visit: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=830387
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Program",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}\\server.js",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "outFiles": []
        },
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "attach",
            "name": "Attach to Process",
            "port": 5858,
            "outFiles": []
        }
    ]
}
```

What do I need to do to be able to use the debugger?
